name: Tormentum - Dark Sorrow
description: TORMENTUM is a dark Point & Click adventure game.The dreamlike, nightmarish atmosphere of the game was inspired by works of painters H.R. Giger and Zdzislaw Beksinski. The game's final look and feel was also strongly influenced by the universes of games such as Demon's Souls or Dark Seed.

reviews.review_text: Guess I'm gonna be that guy, but only purchase this game if you are more interested in the artwork than the actual gameplay. If you are more interested in the gameplay, I think the game is overpriced.  This game is ridiculously short. My first game took me around two hours (probably a bit less, but I kept AFKing so I can't say for certain); my second game only took me an hour (I made the opposite choices as the first game and skipped all previously read dialogue). If you're an achievement hunter, three runs is the most you'll need to get them all.  As for the puzzles, they're extremely basic. The only puzzles that can't be immediately solved happen to have a hint on a scrap of paper nearby. None of them require much thinking.  I found the story to be underwhelming. I expected much more because of the high quality of the art. At the end of my first game, I honestly cared very little for the main character. The dialog is fine, and there are some notes and journal/book pages that give you some background, but it never felt like there was enough.  As a game, I feel like it didn't deliver. It was short, easy, and had a basic story that seemed to only be there as an excuse to show off the artwork. As interactive artwork, it's quite creepy and grotesque and beautiful. Honestly, I think they could've just sold this as a digital artbook and charged quite a bit more.   As stated at the beginning of this review, if you're interested in the artwork, then it's definitely worth the price. If you're interested in a dark fantasy game with a rich world, good story, and solid puzzles, then I think you'll be disappointed.

A tad macabre story with beautiful graphics. Not quite horror, but discomforting enough to keep you on your toes. Can't reveal much without spoiling the story. Recommended to lovers of the weird/dark side of visual arts.

Best visual art I've ever seen in a game! A true masterpiece inspired by Giger and Beksinski. The plot is really interesting and moral choises give it a nice replay value! The ending was amazing! Also, contains some really high quality bonus art in the credits which were the only credits I actually didn't skip! ;) What are you waiting for! Go buy the game already!

I bought this game because I loved the art, not really knowing much on it other than the video and pics. I really loved this game. Art and music was great, the story was actually really interesting. I really want more from the makers. I'll def be doing another play through for the different ending and to get more achievements!
I can't remember the last time an adventure game sucked me in like Tormentum - Dark Sorrow did. Great puzzles, design and soundtrack. Watch out for this one, it's gonna do well.

There's an ultimatum so you must continue playing. It will all make sense; it may affect you personally.  I hope this is enough to keep you playing.  It's especialliy interesting, maybe, if you someone who appreciates art. The game has style and for me it was very intruiging.

A little different from most Point and Click games I play, but overall a fun experience. The puzzles are challenging but casual enough you only need a bit of trial and error to figure them out.   However, I think the price tag is too steep for a game that only took 3 hours to finish. If you can catch it on sale, it's very much worth it.

Oldschool point & click adventure, with graphics clearly inspired by artists like H.R. Giger & Z. Beksinski. Awesome little game with choices that affect the ending. No spoilers, just one advice: CHOOSE WISELY! 10/10
Gorgeous puzzle game, with fascinatingly disturbing art work.
a very good game!

A short and simple, yet very beautiful point and click adventure.  The main thing that attracted me to this title were its visuals, they're gorgeusly grotesque, like a less phalic H.R. Giger art style blended in with Dante's Divine Comedy. Combine that with the soundtrack that perfectly captures each screen you pass and you get a very atmospheric experience. I hope that at some point, they will release the soundtrack.  But yes, like mentioned, I believe the story is a take on the Divine Comedy, with the main protagonist taking a journey of redemption through his personal hell. Throughout this journey, you meet lots of characters who are corrupt in their own way and it's up to your own judgement to decide what choices to make when presented with a situation. Things aren't always what they seem.   My only gripes with the game are its short length and the puzzle difficulty, it's nothing new and everything can be completed fairly quickly. The only thing that holds it up are the choices you are presented within the game, which affect your journey and the final outcome of things. I also believe that for what it is, the game could have benefitted with a failure system of some kind, although not knowing whether it was a possibility definitely helped my experience.  But anyway, if you enjoy art styles similar to H.R. Giger or that of the Dark Souls franchise, I think you'll enjoy this title as much as I did, definitely worth a playthrough or two.
great game. superb graphic n audio style, cool story. got stuck a bit too much 2 times. will play again someday.

It's a straightforward point and click adventure game. I don't want you to get the wrong impression by me using the word 'straightforward,' though. In my opinion, most games in this genre have a horrible problem of including puzzles that are either too vague to figure out or having solutions that make no sense to anyone except the developers of the game. I've seen some people complaining that the game's puzzles are too easy, but to me, that just means the mechanics were clearly telegraphed, which is the sign of a good game. In my opinion, I shouldn't have to be running around, trying hundreds of different combinations in a desperate attempt to make progress in the game.  The story is pretty basic, but the world they created to host it is not. I almost wish they'd done more with some of these characters in regards to how they interact and where they end up after you're done with them.  The artwork is obviously gorgeous and lends to the experience a lot.   Sound is pretty good too. I can maybe see why they chose not to, but I think including voice acting for the dialogue would have gone a long way for this game. In general, I think they could have done a little more with the audio to really bring the world to life, but that's just my opinion.  The game is short, but it does encourage at least one replay, so there's that, and it may also seem shorter than other games in the genre just because it's so incredibly well streamlined and clear. If you encounter it on sale and are at all interested, you probably won't be disappointed.
DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine

Beautiful, intriguing and scary artwork. Great game, although it was a bit too easy and a bit too short. The mini-game puzzles in the game could also have been more challening. Other than that, the game was really good, and I recommend it.
I loved the art style, atmosphere, choices and mini-games. It's not a long or hard game, but very satisfying nonetheless and I definitely recommend it.

A little short, but still incredible. The artwork is some of the best I've ever seen in a point and click adventure game. The puzzles are hard enough, and the atmosphere is grim, dark, and all in all lovely.  All in all if you are in any way a fan of adventure games, and don't mind paying for a shorter experiance, I'd highly reccomend that you buy this game.
It's fun and compelling, if a little short. There are multiple endings and your choice does affect the game. If you're a fan of point and click puzzlers then I think you should definitely pick it up.

Good game, great art work! Only thing is be aware that it took me 4 hours to complete- and I was using my non dominate hand to control the mouse (pinched nerve in my right) and I'm not quick on puzzles. I was a little disappointed that I paid $12 for a 4 hour game with pretty much no re playability. I still enjoyed it, just wish the price was lower or the play time longer. Just a heads up! I'm having my husband play it now, since I enjoyed it- plus helps get my money's worth ;)

A must-play for anyone who likes adventure/puzzle games. The puzzles aren't complicated, making for a nice flowing, relaxing game--a good entry into the genre.  Outstanding visuals.  Immersive characters and story make for thought-provoking descision-making, which affects outcome.

I played Tormentum 3 times in a row. It's a short game and a bit linear, but the art style and aesthetics is well worth it. A unique, dark journey with amazing visuals. It's not perfect and the puzzles are fairly easy, but I was satisfied with my experience. 8/10

This game is a great point and click adventure. It's not very difficult, but fun though. The artwork is simply stunning! It feels like you are in some kind of weird painting the whole time. Also the soundtrack is great and matches the atmosphere well. The story is very simple. Don't expect too much from it.  The only negative point in my opinion is the choice system. You only have either good or bad choices. There's nothing in between. What I like though, is that your choices really have consequences in some places. Little consequences, but I liked it. So I played it twice too see each choice and both endings ;D  For this price it is a great choice for an evening or two.
The story is quite straight forward, the puzzles are fair and enjoyable, the artwork is excellent. It is well worth the asking price.

This is a game that I highly recommend. If your new to point and click adventures this one is a great way to introduce yourself to the genre. It took me a full five hours to complete the story on my first playthrough and I will for sure be playing it again.   The puzzles can be tricky at first but completing them always gives a nice feeling of satisfaction. The story was quite enjoyable and is one of the reasons to warrent a second full playthrough.  The artwork is the real reason to playthrough it again becuase it is sometimes breathtaking.  I highly recommend giving this a try and the best thing is there is a DEMO!!!

I find is absolutely bizzare that the metacritic score isn't far far higher from this absolutely wonderful game.   Gameplay wise, its a point and click adventure; solve this logical puzzle, find that item, nothing too complicated. Its not difficult and does absolutely nothing gameplay wise.   BUT, the asthetics are absolutely incredible both in the visual and sound department. It also features some supprising moral choices to add in some replay value and a beautifully crafted subtle narrative.   As a experience, this was one of the best I'd had in years and all for such a low price. Its less than a tenner, only takes 4 hours to beat and is a hugely memorable experience. If you think about all the money you spent on dreadfully broken and disapointing games last year and find a experience as good as this for such a low price then their really is no excuse not to play this.

I'll be damned... this game was a total surprise! I must admit that this is a very well done adventure! Biggest pros? Excellent graphic-art style Very interesting story Perfetct dark atmosphere Plot twists Ending based on your acts  Recommendation: do NOT use any walkthrough!!! The game is not difficult! ...your decision in game however... can be very difficult : )

Pretty Cool game. a little on the short and easy side. but def. worth the sale price. i eneded up w/ an evil ending for only 1 evil decision i made. the music is dark and has a decent ambience at times. i reckon i'll play through a few more times to unlock achieves.
Great Game. Great art, atmosphere. The story and puzzles were weird at times but never bad. The music is rad as heck too. Well worth $12!!
This game is a masterpiece of art, though, unfortunately, short. Highly recommend if you like dark art - you can gaze at every location by hours.

Art = 10/10 (Depressing, gothic, nightmarish/horror, weird - if you feel like playing a game with all those themes without the alarming sense that jump scare horror games give you, this game is something you should look into.)  Story = 8/10 (Game can be finished in 3-4 hrs which is perfect because it doesnt over stay its welcome)  Gameplay = Too hard to give a number to because some people will find the puzzles too easy and others just right. Personally, I hate being stuck in puzzles for too long because I like being engrossed into the world and so I don't mind puzzles that take somewhere between 2-5 minutes max.

Finished the game twice already! 2 achievements left! The art design is sublime and beautiful! Even after finishing the game, the themes presented will keep you thinking well beyond... The game does not punish you or kill you off! it is a soft ride through a disturbing landscape...  Look into the abyss and enjoy the look you get back
Deliciously dark and beautifully painted gothic adventure game. Each screen is popping with detail of the macabre. Do your self a favour and loose your self in this adventure.

Lovely game with very incredible artwork. Chilling, interesting, and overall a great bit of entertainment. There are a few things(puzzles) that don't quite make sense right away or necessarily feel like you are doing anything more than guessing but for the most part it's a good game just for teh sake of it's own storytelling.

An Amazing Point & Click Adventure that makes you sit back in awe at the amazing art on show, this game has a dark look to it that works so well, worth every penny just to see it.  The game's story is enjoyable, though I found it easy to see where it was going, was also nice to actually see myself regret some choices.  My only complaints about the game is the lack of a fail-state, once I realised nothing could hurt or kill me It took a little bit of the atmosphere with it, also the game is a little short, it only took me 2 hours per playthrough and its 100% complete. However thats a minor thing compared to the whole package and what your getting to experience for the price.  I'd give it a 9/10. If you love this style of game or art, grab it and help support these amazing people.
I loved this game.
Amazing art. Would love to see a second game.

To anyone whos deciding whether or not to buy this game its well worth it. The art style is outstanding and the music is awesome. I've always loved point and click puzzle games like this i guess thats why i like it so much. If your curious to see anything about the game ill be streaming it on twitch for the rest of the week or until i beat it. Over all though i do love this game alot so far =D.
There is something about this game that just mesmerizes you and you just don´t want to leave it until you are done with it.  Amazing.
Great point and click game also the soundtrack and the art style are awesome more like darksouls

Stunning! Art, music and gameplay are all stunning! I got so caught up in the game I spent one full night playing thru it and I am ready to play it some more today just to see the what the other choices will bring for me! I highly reccommend this game to all.

This game is extremely Metal. The aesthetic is delightfully eerie and dark, never having to resort to the cheap 'survival horror' effects so many games these days are using.  The puzzles and point & click mechanics are intuitive and well designed enough to keep you going, though less intimidating than the constant sense of doom instilled by the narrative.  The story however, to me falls short. The choices matter and affect the rest of the game, which is great, but I was disappointed that everything's reduced to cookie cutter 'good vs evil'. Seems there was room for more depth than that.  It doesn't help that the game is pretty short for the asking price, and that's on sale. I expected a single run to be at least twice as long, and the only incentive to play again is to 100% the achievements, otherwise there's no compelling reason.
Very pretty game but puzzles are way too easy and it runs poorly because it runs on adobe air
Too simple, not enough game play for the price. Focuses more on the art style, which is undoubtledly beautiful, than the content.

Summary: A game rich in atmosphere, which is worth playing at the right price.  Pros: Beautiful art and setting in the style of Zdzisław Beksiński Fair puzzles/clear choices.  Cons: Most of the moral choices are essentially palette swaps (either push the good button or the evil button), so playing through twice to see everything and both endings is going to be tedious.   Neutral: A very short game. It takes about two to three hours on a first playthrough. This can be good or bad depending on what you're looking for. The puzzles are all pretty simple. If you just want a light endrophine rush of puzzle solving, this might be good, but people looking for a challenge may be disappointed.  I enjoyed my time playing Tormentum and seeing its beautiful art. I'd say it's an excellent $5 game, but I can't recommend it for more than that right now unless you really want to see the art and have some light puzzling.
The art is great, but the game really shallow. Weak controls, really, really weak story and dialogue. Just could not care less after half an hour.

I am normally not one to like this style of game - point-and-clicks just aren't my thing. Yet, somehow, this game struck my interest. I had heard it discussed and a few clicks through Steam and I was checking out the amazing artwork. Next thing I knew I was clicking 'Add to Cart' and haven't looked back.  EDIT: I wanted to make sure I noted that this game DOES have a demo! This is an excellent feature to have that is lacking in many games these days. If you want a true test of how this game is, skip the review and play the game yourself!  Let me get a few things straight:  This game is short. As an avid gamer but inexperienced in this genre, it took me about three hours to complete. Unlike other games of this type, I never found the puzzles to be too hard or too easy. Only once did I have to look up a hint which turned out to just be me not paying close enough attention. If you're looking for a serious mental struggle, you may not find it here. But, for someone who approaches this game more casually, I loved it.  Normally I try to look at how many hours I get out of a game compared to what I pay for it to find some balance. This game gets a bit of an exception just since I enjoyed myself so much. Normally I'd say a game this short would not be worth the price (and that may factor into your decision) but for me I am happy to support this developer and hope they make more in this vein.  There are moral choices in the game, which is hardly a new idea, but it's interesting to see how the game has subtle changes based on the decisions you make. The end result is more or less the same, but still, it's fun and gives it a level of replayability just to see the other options.  To me the story was interesting to follow and gives you just enough answers to understand what is going on but just enough mystery to make you wonder more about the world and what it may hold. I'd personally love to get to see more like it. Is it completely original? No, but it does what it does well.  The art alone is no reason to buy a game, but this game has some of the coolest I've seen in a while. It is detailed and interesting but not too cluttered, which is important for a point-and-click if you ask me. Gives me serious H. R. Giger vibes and as a huge Alien(s) fan, keep it coming.
I enjoyed this game full on play. Would definetely reccomend to others.

Tormentum is a amazing point 'n click adventure game  This game has beautiful and dark visuals Amazing music that fits in perfectly to the dark atmosphere of the game Fun puzzles and a interesting story  It may be a bit expensive for a point 'n click game, but I think the amazing visuals and the music makes it worth buying

This is one of my new favorite games. The puzzles weren't too difficult but they were still interesting. The story was very interesting and very dark. The art work and music in this game is truly amazing! They should print a book of just the art.

As a 'point and click' lover I was in search of something different in the genre. Tormentum was that something. The game is dark and twisted and keeps you shrouded in suspense and mystery throughout the journey. I found myself playing this through the wee hours of the night. The artwork is fantastic and mind blowing and the characters are interesting and also morbid. I have never played a point and click that resembles anything close to this game. The way it is setup there are multiple reasons for replay. Awesome feast for the eyes and mind!

Amazing game with stunning graphics, the imagination of the world and creatures is insane and will definitely make you love it even more. I loved all the different characters in it, a rat prisoner, jester, villagers with animal skulls, the mage and all the other random characters you meet along the way.  The decision making is also great and will definitely make you think about how it is going to affect you in the end and the game either makes you like a character or dislike them and it will definitely change your mind about them! If you think you like a character in it or think you trust them, prepare to think the opposite half an hour later!  And don't get put off by the horror tag either if you're not a fan of horror because there are absolutely no jump scares at all, the atmosphere of the game is quite eerie and there is a lot of death, but it's a great game to make you think and send shivers down your spine. Be warned although it is not scary, the amazing artwork is quite gory at times but nonetheless stunning!  Also very twisty ending ;) It will make you want to play the game all over again, I played the game straight for a whole day and finished it in about 4 1/2 hours, probably would take you half that time second time round, and trust me you will want to play it again, change the choices you make and see what happens!  Overall this is one of the first point-and-click games I've played and boy did I love it! A must have for absolutely ANYONE, hardcore gamers, point-and-click fans, FPS fanboys, open world enthusiasts, RPG nerds ANY ♥♥♥♥ING ONE :D The creators of this game did a great job!  P.S. If you were a fan of the art as well they've also released an artbook for the game which I will definitely have to get!

So.. this is the very first review of mine so don't expect too much (do not expect the best english either, since I'm german).  I actually bought the game not knowing what to expect, because all I looked at was the name and some of the screenshots. I waited about a month or so to actually start to play the game but I then finished it in one run, because I was bound to the story and the fascinating art (by that I mean the soundtrack, the philosophy and.. basically everything!). It took me about 2-3 hours and it REALLY was worth the while (maybe not worth 12€, but I'm fine with that).  If you'd ask me if I recommend it, it'd definitely say YES. For me personally, the 12€ is worth for 2-3 hours of a game (if you want to hunt those achievements and/or get all possible endings probably 7-9 hours), since I'm interested in art.  That's it from me.
Awesome story, really great look, I personally love it!

Such a GREAT Game!  Very good story, and simple to understand, the art design is very gothic and GORGEOUS. Very simple to play, and some complex puzzles. Only downside in my opinion is that its a bit small, but even tho i HIGHLY recommend it.  100% Worth.  9.5/10
very amazing game! i loved the art style so much! truly great and the choices were very tough

Great art and music. The story is interesting. The puzzles are fairly straightforward. Overall it is a short game but definitely worth playing. You might be able to get one replay out of it just to see the other ending.

Just finished completing this game twice and unlocking all 34 achievements.  It took me 4 hours.  It was a Beautiful 4 hours.  11/10 would recommend.  Beautiful art.  Uncomplicated UI.  Interesting concept. Seeing the different consequences of moral decisions on both playthoughs was very rewarding.  Please buy this game, it's overwhelmingly positive for a reason.

Interesting game, if you're into dark-themed imagery and dialogue. Simple enough for any point-and-click adventurer, and can be completed in a matter of days. Puzzles can be challenging, but for the most part are easy enough to solve. The most challenging thing in the game is gathering the correct (sometimes hidden) items needed to solve puzzles.   The dialogue is short and to the point. Leaves a lot to the imagination of what's going on.  Replay value is there, if you enjoyed it the first time you will enjoy it the second time by choosing different critical decisions that balance life/death for some non-playable characters.  Overall, I give the game a 7/10. Give it a try!

I am not a huge adventure game fan, but the art work of this game drew me in. I was not disappointed. The art work is excellent throughout. Great ambiance and intriguing story. While it is short, I feel the length was appropriate to the story. I plan on playing through again. I rate 8.5/10.
I LOVED this game. Amazing artwork, Lesson in Morality, and Original Design. A+

Absolutely fantastic game. If you are a fan of the style, the artwork is gorgeous and it sets a great tone as you navigate the world. The puzzles provide some obstacles but are not so difficult as to lead to frustration which might pull you out of the experience. It definitely encourages poking around at bits of the background to find things tucked away in buckets and barrels but everything makes sense and doesn't fall prey to'adventure game logic' much. The first play through took me about 3 hours which was just enough time to wrap up the journey and keep things from feeling like they were overstaying their welcome. There are choices to make, and it may be worth a 2nd playthrough if you want to see the other options you could have taken and their results. All in all, if you like adventure games, and you are at all drawn by the art style, it's very much worth taking the time to experience it. My one disappointment is that while there's a physical art book available on the developer site, there is no digital book ):

We'll be short and to the point in this. It's a great looking game, with an interesting story, choices that have a lasting effect on what you think is right and wrong, and overall I feel...is worth the pricetag.
Anwesome art, great puzzles, amazing music! Please devs, do more like this!

very amazing game! i loved the art style so much! truly great and the choices were very tough

very much a classic adventure game. puzzles are relatively easy as the point of the game is more about the story and the choices you make rather than if you can spell Rumpelstiltskin backwards or not. Its short (i playe din about 4 hours) and I am not sure how much replayability there is. Definitely stays with you after you finish it and leaves a lasting impression. I can't wait to see more from this developer.

A game with beautiful art direction (and when say beautiful I mean Hardcore Awesome!) , Good but Easy Puzzles & Consequential Decisions from beginning to end,  'We all have a Light & Darkside inside of us, What matters is what we choose to act on'
A classic point&click adventure game, which is already good for me. Beautifull artwork and nice subtle music. It's logical and doesn't include pixel-hunting. I wish there would be more of this kind.

A well made P&C game. The art is a mix of H.R. Giger and Dark Souls. The puzzles are not hard/impossible or doesn't make any sense, it is almost pretty easy I can say because the game gives you some hints.   There are 2 alternative endings, good replayability :)   Does it worth? Yes, totally.

Without a doubt one of the best point and click adventure games I have played!  Really love the artwork combined with well chosen music. Puzzles were easy but I didn't mind (at least everything made sense and no illogical item combinations were involved), story was enjoyable and involved some wisdom teaching.  I'd only wish it was longer.  Definately recommended!
great puzzle game, with great artwork.

Tormentum is amazing. I recommend it strongly to you who enjoy the art, and maybe aren't too good at puzzles. The puzzles are quite simple and straight forward. For me the game gave of a strong dark souls vibe, mixed with a classic fantasy point and click game. Even tho the dialog was a bit peculiar at time, the game has a nice flow and everything is rather straight forward, the puzzles are not those you get stuck on for days or even hour. As for replayability, I'd say it's nice to play twice, so you can go both ways in the moral decisions, but I don't think you'll get anything new out of it after two playthroughs.   All and all, it's a really good game with amazing scenery!

This is a very good adventure clicker/puzzle game. The artwork is amazing, in fact you could also consider it an animated novel with some very interesting puzzles thrown in. The puzzles are not to hard and all of them fit very well with the environment. It is a casual game with interesting characters and HR Giger inspired art.  The only issue I had with the game was its duration, it took about 4 hours to play start to finish. I would still recommend it.
I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who loves Zlzislaw Beksinski.   Only downside is that a single first time playthrough runs around 4~ hours.
